location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the first folio with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 21; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence concerning the temporary buoying of the channel to the Ras Kadhama anchorage, at the western end of Kuwait Bay. The request was made by the Kuwait Oil Company, to enable them to land oil well drilling material, and the work was carried out by the Persian Gulf lights and buoys ship Nearchus, which was under the control of the Port Director and Director-General of Navigation, Basra.The file includes correspondence from the company, and an extract from a Kuwait intelligence summary, describing the company's pier at Ras Kadhama.The file includes a divider, which gives a list of correspondence references contained in the file by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.
